Row.Text: Blessings be upon you, Princess Loolilalu of the Candy Canyon Kingdom. We thank the stars above that we have you as our leader, Your Highness! Your domain stands as a beacon of light among the pastel pink plains, welcoming many visitors. With your suave diplomacy the area has remained tranquil, and your economic decisions led to the Kingdom becoming a local powerhouse of commerce and culture.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]That was until one day, when you heard wails of panic erupting from the city centre. Bursting from your study to investigate, you realise the Candy Canyon is gone, replaced with lush green fields in all directions. Your spell of gazing upon this new world is cut short, as your guards alert you to unknown foes approaching from the south, wielding weaponry never before seen in your delectable, delicious homeland.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Noble princess, the Kingdom seeks your guidance. The wall must hold. Are you capable of repelling this unforeseen threat to your people? Can your despondent subjects count on their humble sovereign to protect them? Can you build a civilization that stands the test of time?

Known as the Candy Kingdom for short, The Candy Canyon Kingdom is home to Princess Loolilalu and her hundreds of loyal subjects. Specialising in syrup farming, the Kingdom became renowned across the land for the sweet, full flavour of their primary export. Loolilalu and her people became prosperous, building up this once humble outpost into a well-fortified and self-sustaining kingdom. Loolilalu's cities here are named after the sweet desserts that she so adores.

While sat in her study drafting some diplomatic paperwork, the Princess felt an odd shift in her stomach and shaky vision. Reaching to a glass of water and taking a gentle sip, she didn't feel much better. A light fatigue set in, and a few minutes later she was awoken to the sounds of screaming from outside. Shaking her head and getting up from her chair, Loolilalu ran out of her study to investigate. Their kingdom was intact, but the entire surrounding environment had changed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The subjects and Loolilalu herself were caught completely offguard and had no earthly idea how this had happened. In reality - or well, virtual reality - Caine and Pomni's dimension hopping out of The Amazing Digital Circus had caused unpredictable effects to the code Caine carried with him. This code included an in-progress build of a second scenario in The Candy Kingdom, so when he ventured to follow the other cast-members into this Civilization V game-world, Loolilalu and her people were brought along for the ride as well.

Adored by her people and respected by her contemporaries, Princess Loolilalu is the sweetly-dressed sovereign of The Candy Canyon Kingdom. She has unwillingly entered the virtual world of Civilization V along with her people. With those skilled people, the Kingdom continues to possess the capability of farming for Syrup. Her populace are very pious, and the presence of sweet luxuries only improves that dedication to their religion.
Princess of The Candy Canyon Kingdom

Gain +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith from [ICON_RES_SUGAR] Sugar, [ICON_RES_COCOA] Cocoa, [ICON_RES_CITRUS] Citrus, [ICON_RES_SPICES] Spices and [ICON_RES_BANANA] Banana tiles. Temples provide +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food.

Unique Ability of the Candy Canyon Kingdom[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith from [ICON_RES_SUGAR] Sugar, [ICON_RES_COCOA] Cocoa, [ICON_RES_CITRUS] Citrus, [ICON_RES_SPICES] Spices and [ICON_RES_BANANA] Banana tiles. Temples provide +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food.

Constructed by The Candy Canyon Kingdom, the Maple Sugarbush is capable of harvesting extra food from a standard forest by tapping the trees for syrup. This syrup also sells for a decent profit.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]A 'sugar bush' refers to a camp set up around maple trees for the purpose of harvesting maple syrup. Loolilalu's people have mastered this technique, bolstering the Kingdom's economy and feeding their people with the same delicious crop.

The Maple Sugarbush can only be built on a Forest tile. It provides additional [ICON_FOOD] Food and [ICON_GOLD] Gold. Also provides extra [ICON_FOOD] Food at Civil Service and [ICON_GOLD] Gold at Guilds.

Constructs a Maple Sugarbush, which increases the amount of [ICON_FOOD] Food and [ICON_GOLD] Gold provided by this tile, while keeping the Forest intact. Also provides extra [ICON_FOOD] Food at Civil Service and [ICON_GOLD] Gold at Guilds.

It will increase the amount of [ICON_FOOD] Food and [ICON_GOLD] Gold provided by this tile, while keeping the Forest intact. Also provides extra [ICON_FOOD] Food at Civil Service and [ICON_GOLD] Gold at Guilds.

The War Rig is cheaper but has less Combat Strength than the Cavalry, which it replaces. Does not require [ICON_RES_HORSE] Horses. It may also perform a one-time Eclair Delivery to earn Gold and XP. May only be built by the Candy Canyon Kingdom.

A modified delivery vehicle with a quote "knarly pokey-thing" mounted on the front, and a "syrup-powered super turbo" equipped in the engine bay. As per the Princess' specifications![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Each War Rig is given a load to deliver to foreign markets - a comically huge Eclair dessert. Successful delivery of this dessert earns the Kingdom money, and the driver lots of recognition.

A delivery truck re-purposed for the war effort. This unit provides the Eclair Delivery promotion, is cheaper, but has a lower combat strength compared to the Cavalry, which it replaces. This unit does not require Horses - instead, the War Rig is fuelled by maple syrup.
The War Rig carries an Eclair as cargo. May sell the Eclair when adjacent to a foreign tile to gain [ICON_GOLD] Gold and XP based on distance from capital, but only once.
